before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"anf6","text":"Add the appropriate amount of ethanol (96-100%; required volume is listed on the label of each bottle) to Buffers AW1/AW2 if necessary (they are included in the kit as concentrates and need to be diluted). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"5d6km","text":"This DNA extraction protocol was used in Rodriguez et al., 2024 (in prep) for the extraction of environmental DNA from samples collected off of the coast of Ireland (Atlantic) and Norway (Norwegian Sea) as a part of the eWHALE project. Work was carried out by researchers at University College Cork (UCC) and the Institute for Marine Research (IMR). The protocol outlines lysis from Sterivex (0.45 µm pore size; Merck Millipore ID: SVHV010RS) eDNA filters and DNA extraction of lysates using the Qiagen DNeasy Blood and Tissue Kit. Mostly, the protocol follows the official version with spin columns published by Qiagen for the DNeasy Blood and Tissue Kit (available here: https://www.qiagen.com/us/resources/resourcedetail?id=68f29296-5a9f-40fa-8b3d-1c148d0b3030\u0026lang=en), however, researchers at IMR used a QiaVAC 24 Plus vacuum system (ID: 19413, Qiagen) rather than centrifugation for spin column steps. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":673,"length":98}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"C4DB8CA619B511EFAE230A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.qiagen.com/us/resources/resourcedetail?id=68f29296-5a9f-40fa-8b3d-1c148d0b3030\u0026lang=en"}}}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"dh8vu","text":"Lysis should be done in a laminar flow hood. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"42s7b","text":"Always change pipette tips while working with different lysates. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"affjt","text":"All centrifugation steps should be carried out at room temperature (15–25°C). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3u90k","text":"All reagents in the DNeasy extraction kit are viable for 1 year under the appropriate conditions (kept in a dry space at room temperature). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2ja0s","text":"If Buffer AL precipitates at any point, warm to 56°C until the precipitate disolves. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"9habq","text":"- DNeasy Blood \u0026 Tissue Kit (ID for 50 preps: 69504 50, Qiagen)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5r7ip","text":"- Pipettes : monochannel p10, p100, p1000, p5000 and corresponding filter tips","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9vbs3","text":"- 1.5 mL and 2 mL microcentrifuge tubes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7riif","text":"- Ethanol (96-100%)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
protocol_references: {"blocks":[{"key":"f5a0m","text":"Detailed guidelines and ordering information can be found on the official product webpage: https://www.qiagen.com/us/products/discovery-and-translational-research/dna-rna-purification/dna-purification/genomic-dna/dneasy-blood-and-tissue-kit","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":91,"length":149}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"ACADE18319B611EFAE230A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.qiagen.com/us/products/discovery-and-translational-research/dna-rna-purification/dna-purification/genomic-dna/dneasy-blood-and-tissue-kit"}}}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7j9hu","text":"Remove filters from the freezer and allow to thaw at room temperature for   . Ensure that all filter capsules are properly closed and labeled. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":74,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fm4pb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":2700,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"13lgn","text":"Invert filters a couple of times to agitate lysate. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2j697","text":"Incubate filter capsules at   for   . Invert filters every 30 minutes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":28,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":34,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"47dcj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"56","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":10800,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b74pr","text":"Label 2 mL screw cap tubes or microcentrifuge tubes for all   . ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":60,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"c4a8v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"sample","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"group_guid":"6202AF4118224B2BBE98261BB6D79307","guid":""}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9bl0m","text":"Using a 2 or 3 mL syringe, evacuate the lysis buffer from the filter capsule by pushing in 1 mL of air (while holding the filter horizontally) then evacuating the lysis buffer (while holding the filter vertically). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dbtgr","text":"Add the   from the syringe (0.5 - 2 mL) to the associated labeled tube. {"blocks":[{"key":"3jo63","text":"After incubation, vortex tubes for    then add   Buffer AL. {"blocks":[{"key":"ehfdr","text":"Vortex again for   then add   ethanol (96-100%). {"blocks":[{"key":"6j7mo","text":"Pipette the mixture (including any precipitate) into a labeled DNeasy Mini spin column placed in a 2 mL collection tube. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7nvf6","text":"Place the spin column into a clean 1.5 or 2 mL microcentrifuge tube and pipette   Buffer AE onto the spin column membrane. warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"8jn3j","text":"Always use gloves and perform work in a room with adequate ventilation.
